meanings.sent1: I am parboiling the vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She always parboils the pasta before adding the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally started parboiling the eggs for an omelette, but then decided to make scrambled eggs instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun was so hot, it felt like it was parboiling everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm was parboiling the streets, creating steam all around.

meanings.definition: Partially boiling food before finishing it by another method
meanings.sent1: Before grilling, the recipe calls for parboiling the ribs.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys parboiling the chicken wings before frying them for extra crispiness.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was parboiling the potatoes to give them a head start in the oven race.
meanings.sent4: The idea was parboiling the rice of knowledge before fully absorbing it.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the kitchen was palpable as they were parboiling the ingredients for the special stew.
